meanings.definition: Conveying thoughts or feelings in words or actions.
meanings.sent1: She gave an expressing speech at the event.
meanings.sent2: Her expressing face showed how happy she was.
meanings.sent3: His expressing dance moves made everyone smile.
meanings.sent4: The painting was an expressing masterpiece of emotions.
meanings.sent5: The music was so expressing, it brought tears to my eyes.

meanings.sent1: The expressing sign pointed us in the right direction.
meanings.sent2: His expressing gestures made it clear he was upset.
meanings.sent3: The cat's expressing meows were adorable.
meanings.sent4: The dark clouds were an expressing warning of the storm.
meanings.sent5: The map had an expressing symbol for the treasure location.

meanings.sent1: She was expressing her love through the heartfelt letter.
meanings.sent2: The radio tower was expressing signals across the airwaves.
meanings.sent3: He was expressing the important message to his team.
meanings.sent4: The satellite was expressing data to the space station.
meanings.sent5: The email was expressing the urgent request for help.

meanings.definition: Squeezing out a liquid or substance.
meanings.sent1: She was expressing the juice from the oranges.
meanings.sent2: The sponge was expressing water when squeezed.
meanings.sent3: He was expressing the toothpaste onto the brush.
meanings.sent4: The chef was expressing the flavors from the herbs.
meanings.sent5: The clouds were expressing rain as they darkened.

meanings.sent1: The artist was expressing a beautiful painting on the canvas.
meanings.sent2: The factory was expressing new products for the market.
meanings.sent3: He was expressing a delicious meal in the kitchen.
meanings.sent4: The writer was expressing a thrilling story in the book.
meanings.sent5: The tree was expressing fresh leaves in the spring.
